name: orange production, fresh grade | orange, fresh grade | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15278/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of orange, fresh grade. Fresh grade oranges are meant for direct human consumption. The reference flow is the average yield per ha and year in 2015: yield (38.11 t/ha) obtained under irrigated conditions. The data are representative for orange production, fresh grade, in South Africa used for the export market.

This activity starts with the nursery producing fruit tree seedlings, i.e.grafted young trees to be planted.

This activity ends with the waste treatment after the clearing of the orchard. The dataset includes all activities during a year in the productive phase of the orchard including the establishment phase per year of lifetime (33 years), the clearing of the orchard including waste treatment. 
The establishment phase of the orchard includes tree nursery, soil cultivation, planting trees, sowing grass, installation of trellis system (posts and wires) and irrigation. The productive phase of the orchard includes machine operations. Machine operations in the productive phase are: soil cultivation, fertiliser and pesticide application, and irrigation. Direct field emissions and land use change are included. At the end of the productive phase the orchard is cleared.
The inputs of seedlings, fertilisers (N-P2O5- K2O from mineral fertiliser input: 143-35-64 kg/ha*a ) and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0123:Growing of citrus fruits

processDocumentation.timeDescription: This dataset is based on data from the 2015 production year according to CGA Key Industry Ststostics and approved Confronting Climate Change datasets.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for South Africa
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From CCC data to the entire industry based on national production statistics on average yields in 2015.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Real industry data from Confronting Climate Change (CCC) http://www.climatefruitandwine.co.za/. Inventory modelling following the ecoinvent Guidelines.

exchanges.description: Orange, fresh grade, South African production. Output of orange, fresh grade, produced for direct human consumption.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: 100% of input quantity. Calculated based on 2009 pesticide application values from Dabrowski, Shadung, & Wepener (2014) and König (2015) with data on production area from FAO (2012). 
Further references: Koenig, A. (2015). Environmental hotspots and the potential of clean technologies in the South African fruit supply chain. Master thesis at Zurich University of applied Sciences (ZHAW), Institute of Natural Resource Sciences, unpublished; FAO. (2012). Citrus Fruit - Fresh and proceeded - Annual Statistics.

Calculated value. Fraction of irrigation water to air: 0.72. 
Further reference: Quantis Water Database - Technical Report (2012)

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: 100% of input quantity. Calculated based on 2009 pesticide application values from Dabrowski, Shadung, & Wepener (2014) and König (2015) with data on production area from FAO (2012). 
Further references: Koenig, A. (2015). Environmental hotspots and the potential of clean technologies in the South African fruit supply chain. Master thesis at Zurich University of applied Sciences (ZHAW), Institute of Natural Resource Sciences, unpublished; FAO. (2012). Citrus Fruit - Fresh and proceeded - Annual Statistics.

Calculated value: calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2012). Soil heavy metal contents according to Keller & Desaules (2001), erosion average value according to Kooman & Critchley (2013), Le Roux et al. (2008) and UWC Erosion (2015), accumulation factor according to Prasuhn (2006), erosion factor: 0.05, since surface waters between agricultural fields are rare and the distance to the next river or lake is greater than 100 m  according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of inorganic fertilisers according to Desaules & Struder (1993), heavy-metal contents of organic fertilisers according to Freiermuth (2006) from Menzi & Kessler (1998) and Desaules & Studer (1993), dry matter content from Walther et al. (2001), deposition and content of seeds according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of pesticides according to Perkow & Ploss (1994) in Freiermuth (2006). 
Further references:  
Keller T. & Desaules A. (2001) Böden der Schweiz: Schadstoffgehalte und Orientierungswerte (1990 – 1996). Umwelt-Materialien Nr. 139. Bern: Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft BUWAL.
Kooman, G.; Critchley, W. R. S. GIS-Assisted Modelling of Soil Erosion in a South African Catchment: Evaluating the USLE and SLEMSA Approach. In Water Resources Planning, Development and Management; Breetzke, G. D., Ed.; InTech, 2013; 
Le Roux, J. J.; Morgenthal, T. L.; Malherbe, J.; Pretorius, D. J.; Sumner, P. D. Water erosion prediction at a national scale for South Africa. Water SA 2008, 34, 305–314.; 
UWC Erosion http://www.botany.uwc.ac.za/envfacts/facts/erosion.htm (accessed Apr 28, 2015). 
Prasuhn V. (2006) Erfassung der PO4-Austräge für die Ökobilanzierung SALCA Phosphor. Agroscope Reckenholz - Tänikon ART, 20p. Online at http://www.art.admin.ch/themen/00617/00744/index.html?lang=en.
Calculated value: dry matter content = 16%

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'orange, fresh grade' is calculated to be circa 6.35E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium fertiliser, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.27E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: emissions arising from fertiliser use, calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2011). Soil erosion according to Kooman & Critchley; Le Roux at al. (2008); UWC (2015), P content in topsoil according to Nemecek, Kägi T. & Blaser S. (2007), enrichment factor for P according to Wilke & Schaub (1996), 0.05, since surface waters between agricultural fields are rare and the distance to the next river or lake is greater than 100 m. Source: Freiermuth (2006). 
Further references: Kooman, G.; Critchley, W. R. S. GIS-Assisted Modelling of Soil Erosion in a South African Catchment: Evaluating the USLE and SLEMSA Approach. In Water Resources Planning, Development and Management; Breetzke, G. D., Ed.; InTech, 2013 ISBN 978-953-51-1092-7; Le Roux, J. J.; Morgenthal, T. L.; Malherbe, J.; Pretorius, D. J.; Sumner, P. D. Water erosion prediction at a national scale for South Africa. Water SA 2008, 34, 305–314; UWC Erosion Available online: http://www.botany.uwc.ac.za/envfacts/facts/erosion.htm (accessed on Apr 28, 2015); Nemecek, T., Kagi, T., & Blaser, S. (2007). Life Cycle Inventories of Swiss and European Agricultural Production Systems. Final report; Nemecek, T., Kagi, T., & Blaser, S. (2007). Life Cycle Inventories of Swiss and European Agricultural Production Systems. Final report;  Freiermuth, R. Modell zur Berechnung der Schwermetallflüsse in der landwirtschaftlichen Ökobilanz; 2006; pp. 1–42
Literature value. Wood from trees after 1-2 years of sorrage at the field (20% water) per lifetime year (33 years) of the orchard.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of orange, fresh grade is calculated to be circa 6.17E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'benzimidazole-compound', 'bipyridylium-compound', 'copper', 'glyphosate', 'mancozeb', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified', 'pesticide, unspecified', 'phenoxy-compound', 'triazine-compound, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.23E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Fraction of irrigation to surface water: 0.2
Measured value: CCC primary data.

Calculated value: 100% of input quantity. Calculated based on 2009 pesticide application values from Dabrowski, Shadung, & Wepener (2014) and König (2015) with data on production area from FAO (2012). 
Further references: Koenig, A. (2015). Environmental hotspots and the potential of clean technologies in the South African fruit supply chain. Master thesis at Zurich University of applied Sciences (ZHAW), Institute of Natural Resource Sciences, unpublished; FAO. (2012). Citrus Fruit - Fresh and proceeded - Annual Statistics.

Calculated value: calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2011). Heavy metal content of inorganic fertilisers according to Desaules & Struder (1993), heavy-metal contents of organic fertilisers according to Freiermuth (2006) from Menzi & Kessler (1998) and Desaules & Studer (1993), dry matter content from Walther et al. (2001), heavy metal content of plant material according to Mattos at al. (2003), heavy metal content of pesticides according to Perkow & Ploss (1994) in Freiermuth (2006), deposition according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content in exported biomass according to Freiermuth (2006). 
Further references:  Desaules A. & Studer K. (1993) NABO: Nationales Beobachtungsnetz, Messresultate 1985-1991, Schriftenreihe Umwelt Nr. 200, BUWAL (Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft), Bern; Menzi H. & Kessler J. (1998) Heavy metal content of manures in Switzerland. In: Martinez J. and Maudet M.N. (eds): Proc. 8th International Conference on the FAO ESCORENA; Freiermuth R. (2006) Modell zur Berechnung der Schwermetallflüsse in der Landwirtschaftlichen Ökobilanz - SALCA-Schwermetall, Forschungsanstalt Agroscope Reckenholz-Tänikon (ART), 28p; Perkow W. und Ploss H., 1994. Wirksubstanzen der Pflanzenschutz- und Schädlingsbekämpfungsmittel. Berlin: Blackwell Wissenschafts-Verlag.
Literature value

Proxy: Total amount of horticultural oil is calculated based on the ecoinvent dataset Orange, fresh grade ES. For calculations see supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2011). Soil heavy metal contents according to Keller & Desaules (2001), erosion average value according to Kooman & Critchley (2013), Le Roux et al. (2008) and UWC Erosion (2015), accumulation factor according to Prasuhn (2006), erosion factor: 0.05, since surface waters between agricultural fields are rare and the distance to the next river or lake is greater than 100 m  according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of inorganic fertilisers according to Desaules & Struder (1993), heavy-metal contents of organic fertilisers according to Freiermuth (2006) from Menzi & Kessler (1998) and Desaules & Studer (1993), dry matter content from Walther et al. (2001), deposition and content of seeds according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of pesticides according to Perkow & Ploss (1994) in Freiermuth (2006). 
Further references:  
Keller T. & Desaules A. (2001) Böden der Schweiz: Schadstoffgehalte und Orientierungswerte (1990 – 1996). Umwelt-Materialien Nr. 139. Bern: Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft BUWAL.
Kooman, G.; Critchley, W. R. S. GIS-Assisted Modelling of Soil Erosion in a South African Catchment: Evaluating the USLE and SLEMSA Approach. In Water Resources Planning, Development and Management; Breetzke, G. D., Ed.; InTech, 2013; 
Le Roux, J. J.; Morgenthal, T. L.; Malherbe, J.; Pretorius, D. J.; Sumner, P. D. Water erosion prediction at a national scale for South Africa. Water SA 2008, 34, 305–314.; 
UWC Erosion http://www.botany.uwc.ac.za/envfacts/facts/erosion.htm (accessed Apr 28, 2015). 
Prasuhn V. (2006) Erfassung der PO4-Austräge für die Ökobilanzierung SALCA Phosphor. Agroscope Reckenholz - Tänikon ART, 20p. Online at http://www.art.admin.ch/themen/00617/00744/index.html?lang=en.

The exchange has been updated from 'potassium sulfate, as K2O' into 'potassium sulfate' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0001 kg by 1.85 kg of 'potassium sulfate' per kg of 'potassium sulfate, as K2O'. Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (FAO 2005) multiplied by the country-share of fertiliser type (IFA 2014). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Corresponds to 2.03 kg/ha

Further references:  http://www.fao.org/docrep/x0490e/x0490e0e.htm;  Roccuzzo, Giancarlo, Damiano Zanotelli, Maria Allegra, Antonio Giuffrida, Biagio Francesco Torrisi, Antonino Leonardi, Ana Quiñones, Francesco Intrigliolo, and Massimo Tagliavini. "Assessing nutrient uptake by field-grown orange trees." European journal of Agronomy 41 (2012): 73-80.

Master thesis at Zurich University of applied Sciences (ZHAW), Institute of Natural Resource Sciences, unpublished; FAO. (2012). Citrus Fruit - Fresh and proceeded - Annual Statistics.

(2001), deposition and content of seeds according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of pesticides according to Perkow & Ploss (1994) in Freiermuth (2006).
